text:
Columbus Circle (West 59th Street) at the S.W. corner of Eighth Avenue (left).

Across the roofs of these low structures appears a portion of the building at the N.W. corner of 58th Street housing "Reisenweber's, a famous rendezvous.

About 1900

Gift of Urbrock Collection
title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - 8th Avenue (Southwest).

text:
Central Park: Ball Ground and athletic field, and the Green, in the southwestern corner of the Park, with Columbus Circle and Eighth Avenue in the foreground. In the upper left hand corner Central Park West runs off the picture about 69th Street; and in the upper right hand corner may be seen the southern end of the Mall. The old sheepfold, between the West Drive and the 66th Street gate, will be rebuilt in 1934 as an outdoor restaurant, The Tavern on the Green.
In this aerial view the driveways, bridle path, and pedestrian pathways stand out very clearly.

About 1929.

Ewing Galloway.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - Playgrounds [Ball ground and athletic fields and the Green.]

text:
Columbus Circle: The eastern half of same, as viewed northeastward from a structure on Eighth Ave. and showing the Christopher Columbus statue; the Maine Monument and Central Park. Note at the foot of the Columbus column, an Army unit; undoubtedly to feed the unemployed.

About 1930.

Ewing Galloway.
title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - Christopher Columbus statue.

text:
(1)
Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, 1933, No. 1. A balloon representing a chicken, held down close to the street, at Columbus Circle.
The view is south on Eighth Avenue.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
No. 2. The dachshund of this year, with Macy's red star on his left side. Columbus Circle; the view is south at Eighth
Avenue.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
No. 3. A fat man in a bathing suit. The view is southwest.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Macy's Thanksgiving Parade.

text:
Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, 1933, No. 4, at Columbus Circle, showing the giant lying on his face. The view is south, on the west side of Eighth Avenue.
November 30, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

No. 5, at Columbus Circle, showing the hippopotamus in full harness. This view is also south.
November 30, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

No. 6. The pig balloon.
November 30, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

text:
Celebrations Parades Municipal Events:

Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, 1933, No. 7, at Columbus Circle. A large rooster is turning into Eighth Avenue.

November 30, 1933.

P.L.Sperr
